intro: Pentacalia carpishensis, commonly known as the Carpish mountain morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many vines and flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has heart-shaped leaves. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
